document_title: Ovarian functional cysts: Causes, signs and treatments
subsection_name: nang-co-nang-buong-trung.json_6_How to treat functional ovarian cysts
subsection_content:
Dr. Kim Ngan said that functional ovarian cysts do not need treatment, the cysts will disappear on their own after a few menstrual cycles. Patients are asked to monitor the growth of the cyst with repeat ultrasounds after menstruation.
Patients can treat the disease using internal medicine (using medicine). However, in cases where cysts cause dangerous complications, immediate intervention is needed.
Internally medical treatment
The doctor will ask the patient to monitor the development of the cyst for about 1-2 months. After that time, if the cyst size does not decrease and symptoms begin to appear, the doctor may prescribe the patient to use some of the following medications:
Painkillers: Reduce pain caused by the tumor compressing surrounding organs; Birth control pills: Prevent ovulation, thereby reducing the risk of new cyst formation as well as limiting the increase in cyst size.
Note, you need to consult your doctor for appropriate dosage instructions and instructions. Absolutely do not use medicine without a doctor's prescription.
Surgical treatment of functional cysts
In cases where functional cysts cause pain but do not respond to medical treatment, the doctor will prescribe surgery to remove the cyst.
Laparoscopic surgery: Currently a trusted method in cyst removal surgery because it causes less pain for the patient, less hospital stay, and quick recovery.
This method is indicated in cases where the cyst is not too large, not too sticky, not suspected of malignancy or in cases of breast cancer where oophorectomy is indicated.
Laparotomy: In cases where the patient has high risk factors, the cyst is large in size and has an unusual shape, the doctor will prescribe laparotomy to observe the tumor and promptly treat it if it occurs. malignant tumor.
However, this method requires more recovery time. At the same time, the patient will be asked to be hospitalized for a few days before and after surgery to facilitate monitoring and examination.
Laparoscopic surgery to treat ovarian cysts is preferred because it causes less pain, quick recovery time, and less hospitalization. Measures to prevent functional ovarian cysts are recommended by Dr. Kim Ngan, although not recommended. Is there any way to prevent functional ovarian cysts, but women can detect them early, monitor them and treat them effectively if they comply with regular gynecological examinations every 6 months. At the same time, women need to "listen" to their bodies, pay attention to abnormalities in the menstrual cycle each month including cycle time, menstrual symptoms... for early detection, effective treatment, and avoidance. dangerous complications.
